title: How to Remove Windows Genuine Advantage Notifications

steps.title: Make sure that you're connected to the Internet.
steps.content: Make sure that you're connected to the Internet . In order to activate your copy of Windows, you'll need to be connected to the Internet so that Microsoft can validate your key.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen. The Start menu will pop up.

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . Click the gear-shaped icon in the lower-left side of the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Update & Security.
steps.content: Click Update & Security. This circular arrow-shaped icon is at the bottom of the Settings window.

steps.title: Click the Activation tab.
steps.content: Click the Activation tab. You'll find it on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Change product key.
steps.content: Click Change product key . It's a link in the middle of the Activation page. Doing so opens a new window.

steps.title: Enter your Windows 10 product key.
steps.content: Enter your Windows 10 product key. Type the activation key that came with your copy of Windows 10 into the text box. You can usually find the product key on the CD box if you bought a hard copy, or in a confirmation email from Microsoft if you bought a Windows 10 product key online. If you bought a key for Windows 7, 8, or 8.1, you can use that key to register Windows 10. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . It's in the lower-right corner of the window. This will prompt Microsoft to attempt to verify your copy of Windows.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen instructions. If your copy of Windows is legitimate, you should receive a notification that it has been accepted, though you may need to enter additional information if prompted.

steps.title: Make sure that you're on an administrator account.
steps.content: Make sure that you're on an administrator account. You'll need to be on an account that has administrator privileges in order to make changes to your computer's registry.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type in regedit.
steps.content: Type in regedit . This will search your computer for the Registry Editor command.

steps.title: Click regedit.
steps.content: Click regedit . It's a teal collection of blocks at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Yes when prompted.
steps.content: Click Yes when prompted. Doing so will open the Registry Editor window.

steps.title: Go to the "Activation" key.
steps.content: Go to the "Activation" key. To do so: Expand the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE folder by double-clicking it. Expand SOFTWARE Scroll down and expand Microsoft Scroll down and expand Windows NT Expand CurrentVersion Expand Software Protection Platform Click Activation﻿

steps.title: Right-click Manual.
steps.content: Right-click Manual . It's a blue-and-white icon on the right side of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. If your mouse doesn't have a right-click button, click the right side of the mouse, or use two fingers to click the mouse. If your computer uses a trackpad instead of a mouse, use two fingers to tap the trackpad or press the bottom-right side of the trackpad.

steps.title: Click Modify.
steps.content: Click Modify . It's at the top of the drop-down menu. A window will appear.

steps.title: Change the value data.
steps.content: Change the value data. In the "Value data" text box, replace the "0" with a "1", then click OK . You may be prompted to confirm this choice. If so, click Yes or OK before proceeding.

steps.title: Right-click NotificationDisabled.
steps.content: Right-click NotificationDisabled . This item is also on the right side of the page.

steps.title: Click Modify.
steps.content: Click Modify .

steps.title: Change the value data to 1.
steps.content: Change the value data to 1 . This will prevent the activation notification from appearing on your desktop.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. Click Start , click Power , and click Restart in the pop-up menu. Your computer will shut down and then turn itself back on.

steps.title: Repeat this process if the notification reappears.
steps.content: Repeat this process if the notification reappears. While removing the watermark notification will work temporarily, you may need to disable it again in the future.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click the search bar.
steps.content: Click the search bar. It's at the bottom of the Start window.

steps.title: Type in task manager.
steps.content: Type in task manager . This will search your computer for the Task Manager application.

steps.title: Click Task Manager.
steps.content: Click Task Manager . It's at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Open the Run window.
steps.content: Open the Run window. Press ⊞ Win + R at the same time to do so. If this doesn't work, re-open Start , type in run , and click Run .

steps.title: Type in system32.
steps.content: Type in system32 . System32 is a folder that contains many of your computer's sensitive files.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the Run window. This will open the system32 folder.

steps.title: Enable viewing for hidden files and file extensions.
steps.content: Enable viewing for hidden files and file extensions. To do so: Click the View tab. Check the "Hidden items" box. Check the "File name extensions" box.

steps.title: Find the "WgaLogon.dll" file.
steps.content: Find the "WgaLogon.dll" file. The easiest way to do this is by typing wga into the search bar that's in the upper-right side of the window and then waiting for the "WgaLogon.dll" file to appear.

steps.title: Rename the "WgaLogon.dll" file.
steps.content: Rename the "WgaLogon.dll" file. Right-click the file, click Rename , and type .bak at the end of the file name and extension, then press ↵ Enter . The file should now read "WgaLogon.dll.bak" instead. You may be prompted to confirm this choice. If so, click Yes or OK .

steps.title: Create an empty copy of the "WgaLogon.dll" file.
steps.content: Create an empty copy of the "WgaLogon.dll" file. To do so: Right click on a blank space in the system32 window. Select New Click Text Document Type in WgaLogon as the file's name. Replace the .txt with .dll Press ↵ Enter , then click Yes if prompted.

steps.title: Find the "WgaTray.exe" file in both system32 and Task Manager.
steps.content: Find the "WgaTray.exe" file in both system32 and Task Manager. Since you'll need to delete both entries within 5 seconds of each other, you'll want to find them now. To do so: system32 - You should see "WgaTray.exe" in the window if "wga" is still typed into the search bar. Task Manager - Click the Processes tab, scroll down until you find the "WgaTray.exe" option, and click it.

steps.title: Delete both "WgaTray.exe" files.
steps.content: Delete both "WgaTray.exe" files. Select the system32 "WgaTray.exe" file and press the Del key, then switch to Task Manager and click End process or End task in the lower-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Restart your computer when finished.
steps.content: Restart your computer when finished. Once your computer finishes rebooting, your Genuine Advantage notifications should be gone. You may have to repeat this process at some point, since Genuine Advantage notifications often return with critical updates.
